IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Narrated by Tariq ibn Abdullah al-Muharabi: I was in the market of Dhu al-Majaz when a young man passed by me wearing a red striped cloak, saying: 'O people, say there is no deity except Allah and you will prosper!' A man behind him was throwing stones at him, having bloodied his heels and legs, saying: 'He is a liar, do not obey him!' I asked: 'Who is this?' They said: 'A boy from Bani Hashim who claims to be the Messenger of Allah, and this is his uncle Abd al-Uzza.' Later, when Muhammad ﷺ migrated to Madinah and people accepted Islam, we traveled from al-Rabadhah with a lady from our group. When we reached Madinah's outskirts, we changed our clothes. A man on the road asked us where we were from and where we were going. We told him we wanted to buy dates. He asked if we would sell our red camel. We agreed to a price in dates. He took the camel and left. We were worried, saying we had made a bad deal. A woman sitting with us said: 'I saw a man whose face was like a slice of the full moon's light. He will not wrong you or betray you, and I guarantee payment for your camel.' A man came and said: 'I am the Messenger of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. Here are your dates. Eat, be satisfied, and measure.' We ate, measured, took full measure, and were satisfied.

Topics: Incident of the Prophet ﷺ preaching in the market of Dhu al-Majaz
Early preaching of Islam before migration
Incident of trade and kindness in Madinah
The Prophet's ﷺ generosity and character

english_translation: [Continuation of hadith 90321] We then entered Madinah and went to the mosque where he was preaching on the pulpit. We heard him saying: 'Give charity, for charity is better for you. The upper hand is better than the lower hand. Begin with those you are obligated to support: your mother, your father, your sister, your brother, then those nearest to you, then those nearest.' A man from Bani Yarbu' entered. A man from the Ansar stood and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, the Bani Yarbu' killed one of our men in the time of ignorance. Give us retaliation!' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'No mother inherits the burden of her child, no mother inherits the burden of her child' - three times.

IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abi Shaykh al-Muharabi: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ came to us and said: 'O tribe of Muharib, may Allah help you! Do not give me the milk drawn by a woman.' Al-Fadl ibn Dukain said: I saw Amr al-Qays observing this whenever he was given date wine (shiraza), saying: 'This is milk drawn by a woman.'
